bibl.title: Letter from Paul H. Streit to Philip Showalter Hench, January 9, 1953

div1.p: Streit needs documentation for the Camp Lazear flowers before funds can be allocated. Streit regrets his inability to attend the ceremony.

div1.head: Letter from Paul H. Streit to Philip Showalter Hench, January 9, 1953
div1.opener:
WALTER REED ARMY MEDICAL CENTER
WASHINGTON 12, D. C.
OFFICE OF THE COMMANDING GENERAL
9 January 1953
Philip Hench, M. D.
Mayo Clinic
Rochester, Minnesota
Dear Dr. Hench:
div1.p:
I have been waiting for a month to hear from you with
reference to the ceremonies in Havana, particularly with
reference to the cost of the wreaths which were placed on
the busts of Dr. Finlay, Walter Reed, and the other scientists.

The Surgeon General, Major General George E.
Amstrong, has informed me that he cannot make payment
for these wreaths until he gets a statement of some sort
either from you or from the florist who prepared them.
Therefore, I would appreciate very much your giving me a
statement of purchase or a bill from the florist so that I
could transmit the funds to you.

I was never more sorry about anything in my life
than my inability to get out of Washington on the 2nd of
December. It just seems ridiculous that I could not have
found a way to get to Havana in time for the ceremony, but
my transportation people and most of the travel agencies
in the city were working on the problem and they could offer
me no solution. I made a great mistake in not going to
Havana two days prior to the ceremony so as to avoid delay
on account of weather conditions.
With every good wish for the New Year, I am

closer.signed:
PAUL H STREIT
Maj Gen, MC
Commanding
